channel.title: The Aurelia Blog
channel.description: The official blog of the Aurelia project and Core Team.

item.title: Aurelia on GitHub Sponsored Organizations
item.description: Today, we're pleased to share that Aurelia was selected by GitHub to be one of the first open source organizations to participate in their new GitHub Sponsored Organizations program!

item.title: Aurelia vNext - 2019 Fall Update
item.description: As we approach the first major release of Aurelia vNext, we've got a special treat for you. It's time to announce the official framework name and provided a more in-depth look into the work that's been done so far and what's next to come.

item.title: Aurelia Goes Full-time
item.description: Last week we hit a major milestone in Aurelia's history: one of our core team members, Fred Kleuver, was funded to work full-time on Aurelia.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - September 2019
item.description: This month, we've got a number of improvements and fixes to the Aurelia CLI, as well as a number of smaller updates to various parts of Aurelia's core and its plugins. Stay tuned for our upcoming blog post on Aurelia vNext!

item.title: Case Study: Tutors
item.description: Today, I'm pleased to introduce you to Eamonn de Leastar from the Waterford Institute of Technology. He's built an impressive set of learning technologies for the institute using Aurelia. Here he is to tell you all about it and provide some opportunities to get involved as well.

item.title: Advanced i18n with Aurelia and Net at Work GmbH
item.description: Net at Work GmbH [https://www.netatwork.de/] is a product-based consultancy company with a glowing feather in its cap: NoSpamProxy [https://www.nospamproxy.de/en/]. NoSpamProxy is a multi-faceted secure email gateway solution aimed at providing powerful anti-spam and anti-malware capabilities. Moreover, it provides a number of other functionalities such as email encryption, large file transmission, and email disclaimer management.

item.title: Case Study: Evolution Software's Hazelnut Monitor
item.description: Today, I'm pleased to introduce you to Michael Gerfen and Andy Gray from Evolution Software, sharing a bit about their company and the Hazelnut Monitor product. Take it away Michael and Andy!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - June 2019
item.description: Today, we're pleased to share with you the 1.0 release of the Aurelia CLI!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - May 2019
item.description: This month's releases include an update to our Webpack plugin, more improvements to UI virtualization, additional conversion of Aurelia libraries to TypeScript, for improved maintenance and contributor-friendliness, and a few bug and package fixes to other libraries.

item.title: Case Study: Stellarport
item.description: Today, I'm pleased to introduce Ishai Strauss from Stellarport to talk about how they've built their product with Aurelia. Read on to hear from Ishai about Stellarport's experiences integrating Redux with Aurelia and leveraging decorator-based composition with Aurelia's Fetch client.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - April 2019
item.description: Today, we're excited to announce the beta of Aurelia's Web Components plugin, enabling you to use your Aurelia custom elements as Web Component standard custom elements, easily inter-operating with other frameworks.

item.title: How do we React? - Part 3
item.description: This is part 3 of 3 in a series titled "How do we React?" in which I conclude our discussion of how Aurelia handles common React scenarios.

item.title: How do we React? - Part 2
item.description: This is part 2 of 3 in a series titled "How do we React?" in which I discuss how Aurelia handles common React scenarios. In this post, we'll cover Render Props.

item.title: How do we React?
item.description: This is part 1 of 3 in a series titled "How do we React?" in which I discuss how Aurelia handles common React scenarios. In this post, we'll cover HoCs.

item.title: Case Study: Codeline and Aurelia
item.description: Today we're please to introduce one of our Aurelia community members, Giray Temel, to share with you about Codeline's choice of and experience with Aurelia. Take it away Giray!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early February 2019
item.description: We've had a few new releases over the last few weeks. Among them are continued updates to the Aurelia CLI. In fact, we found an issue in the CLI that affected new Webpack projects, so be sure to update your CLI before starting anything new. More details concerning the various releases can be found below.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Late January 2019
item.description: 2019 is off to a great start with another set of releases that address bugs and add new features to Aurelia. We're also continuing to enable more plugins for script-file deploy along the way. Of particular note is our recent improvements to the aurelia-ui-virtualization plugin for virtual and infinite scrolling. What? You didn't know there was an official plugin for that? Check out this demo to see what it can do [https://aurelia-ui-virtualization.now.sh/].

item.title: Aurelia 2018 Year in Review
item.description: 2018 has been an amazing year for Aurelia! We've added long-time requested features and improvements, enabled new ways to deploy apps, shipped modern, no-hassle tooling, improved our documentation, built up financial backing, made huge advancements in our vNext implementation, and grown our core engineering team by adding six new amazing people! Wow!

item.title: Smoke House Project
item.description: Today, I'm pleased to introduce you to Daryl Cober, a member of the Aurelia community who has been building out "Smoke House Project", a skeleton framework for desktop/web/mobile deployment using Aurelia, including a node Web API and a MongoDB. I'll let him share more about what he's working on and his journey to get there. Take it away Daryl!

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early December 2018
item.description: Over the last couple of months our awesome community has been providing great feedback and use cases for the Aurelia CLI. We're so grateful for the way that we've been able to work together. As a result, we've had several CLI updates that not only fix bugs but also add new features. You can read all the details below, along with the notes for our other recent core library and plugin releases.

item.title: Aurelia 2018 Q3 Report
item.description: The third quarter of 2018 was filled with major advances in our vNext Aurelia implementation along with a few cool new updates in today's Aurelia. Read on to hear about what we've accomplished and what's next as we round out 2018 and head into 2019.

item.title: The New Aurelia-CLI Auto-tracing Bundler
item.description: Today, we're pleased to announce the Aurelia-CLI v1.0.0-beta.1 release! The official beta of our CLI now features a new built-in "auto-tracing" bundler, which greatly improves the capability, performance, and usability of the built-in bundler.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early October 2018
item.description: As always, we continue to on improving Aurelia by both fixing bugs and adding new features. In fact, while we're hard at work on Aurelia vNext, we've also been back-porting some new features to the current version of Aurelia.

item.title: Aurelia Release Notes - Early September 2018
item.description: This month we've had big releases for the Aurelia-CLI, the Aurelia Dialog plugin and the Aurelia i18n plugin. Read on to get the details...

item.title: CoinMesh brings Litecoin and Bitcoin dApp development to Aurelia developers
item.description: Today, we're thrilled to invite former core team member and long-time Aurelia community member, Patrick Walters, to share a special announcement regarding the exciting, new project he's been working on. Let's hear what Patrick has been up to...
